passage.title: Why two holes
passage.paragraph: Mr. Smith has two cats. One is very big and the other is quite small. He likes them very much. One day, Mr. Brown, one of his good friends, comes to see him. When he sees two holes in the door - a large hole and a small hole, he is surprised and asks, "My dear friend, why are there two holes in your door?"
"Let the cats in and out, of course," Mr. Smith answers.
"But why are there two holes? Isn't one enough?" asks his friend.
"How can the big cat go through the small hole?" he answers.
